Context:
Program Name: Computer Systems Technician
Code: T191
Credential: Ontario College Diploma
Duration: 2 years (4 semesters)
Method of Study: Full-time (online)
Starting Months: January, September
Domestic Tuition: $4,272.00 *
Location: Online
Program Availability:
- Semester 2024: Open for domestic students
- Semester 2025: Open for domestic students

The Computer Systems Technician (Online) program is a two-year Ontario College Diploma program, focusing on providing students with a broad and in-depth technical base through courses in system support, network administration, and web technologies. It offers the following advantages:
- Completely online format, including lectures, exams, and class projects
- Access to faculty members embedded in Toronto's rapidly growing tech industry
- Flexible schedule for students with busy weekday commitments
This program is open to domestic students only. For international students or those seeking in-person delivery, please check the Computer Systems Technician (T141) program.

*Domestic Tuition fee is subject to change and may not include additional fees or other expenses. Please consult the college website for the most accurate information.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Computer Systems Technician Program (Online) T191 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
The Computer Systems Technician (Online) program at the college is a two-year diploma that provides students with a complete understanding of computer systems. Upon graduation, students will be prepared to write several industry certification exams and are eligible to fulfill the demand for skilled employees in the field.

The college invests in up-to-date networking, wireless, and security lab equipment and uses the NetLab platform for hands-on installation, configuration, and troubleshooting skills development. The institution has been recognized by Cisco Systems as an Area Support Centre and Instructor Training Centre. Students starting the program in January may be required to attend classes during summer months (May to August).

The Technology Requirements for this program include a personal computer with 16 GB RAM minimum, 256 GB SSD Hard Drive (500+ GB is optimal), Quad-core i7 2.4GHz or better, Video card (2GB RAM minimum/4GB RAM recommended), and a Webcam.

Graduates of the program can establish, operate, maintain, and coordinate the use of local and wide area networks, software services, and related computer equipment as Computer system technicians. They may find employment in IT units throughout private and public sectors, providing client support and network technical support. Graduates may also continue their education and receive transfer credits towards a degree. Opportunities exist to earn an Ontario College Advanced Diploma in Computer Systems Technology within two additional semesters.

Required Specifications: 16 GB RAM minimum, 256 GB SSD Hard Drive (500+ GB is optimal), Quad-core i7 2.4GHz or better, Video card (2GB RAM minimum/4GB RAM recommended), and a Webcam.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Computer Systems Technician Program (Online) T191 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
This text describes a Computer Systems Technician advanced diploma program offered by the college. The program takes two additional semesters to complete after earning an Ontario College certificate. Students who finish this program may qualify for entry into university degree programs, specifically Athabasca University BSc-CIS (PD).

Semester 1:
- COMP 1151: IT Essentials
- COMP 1236: Fundamentals of Computing Logic
- COMP 1234: Introduction To Web Development
- GSSC 1027: Personal Finance
- MATH 1162: Mathematics for Computer Technology I
- COMM 2000: Communicating Across Contexts

Semester 2:
- COMP 1176: Introduction to Networks
- COMP 3044: Linux Essentials
- COMP 1250: Introduction to Programming
- COMP 3105: Enterprise Desktop Operating Systems
- MATH 1172: Mathematics for Computer Technology II
- GNED: General Education Elective

Semester 3:
- COMP 3136: Network Infrastructure
- COMP 2064: Identity Management Services
- COMP 2155: Network Automation
- COMP 2148: Professional Workplace Competencies
- COMP 3066: Linux System Administration
- GNED: General Education Elective

Semester 4:
- COMP 3138: Enterprise Networking and Automation
- COMP 2102: Wireless Technology Fundamentals
- COMP 2141: Windows Server Network Infrastructure
- COMP 2156: DevOps For System Administration
- COMP 3061: Cyber Security Fundamentals

Graduates are expected to identify, analyze, develop, implement, verify and document the requirements for a computing environment, as well as contribute to diagnostics, troubleshooting, documenting, and monitoring. Students may be required to take COMM 1000 (Introduction to College Communication) before progressing to COMM 2000.

Alternative study options include in-person delivery of the program. For further information on future study options, see the Transfer Guide.

Context:
The text provides information about a computing program offered at George Brown College. The following are key facts extracted from the text:

1. The program requires students to contribute to diagnostics, troubleshooting, documentation, and monitoring of technical problems using appropriate methodologies and tools.
2. Students will implement and maintain secure computing environments and implement robust computing system solutions through validation testing that aligns with industry best practices.
3. Students are expected to communicate and collaborate with team members and stakeholders to ensure effective working relationships.
4. Students will select and apply strategies for personal and professional development to enhance work performance and apply project management principles and tools when working on projects within a computing environment.
5. Students must adhere to ethical, legal, and regulatory requirements and principles in the development and management of computing solutions and systems.
6. Students will assist with the implementation of computer systems and cloud solutions and install, configure, troubleshoot, maintain, upgrade, and decommission information systems infrastructure for a secure computer systems environment.
7. Students will automate routine tasks using scripting tools and programming languages and install and monitor a database management system in response to specified requirements.
8. Students will provide technical support for information system infrastructure that aligns with industry best practices.
9. Domestic tuition for the program is $4,272.00 for the first two semesters.
10. The program is approved for OSAP funding for eligible applicants.
11. Applicants must have an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent and meet certain grade requirements in English and Math. Mature students may take an Admissions Assessment or consider upgrading to achieve the necessary credits.

Note: The information is subject to change and it's important for students to verify George Brown College fee requirements.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Computer Systems Technician Program (Online) T191 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
George Brown College requires applicants to have grades higher than the minimum stated for admission to their chosen program. Applicants may qualify for course exemptions with college or university credits and can find more information on the Transfer Guide. Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges. The Computer Systems Technician program is offered through the School of Computer Technology at Casa Loma Campus, located at 146 Kendal Avenue. Contact the School of Computer Technology at 416-415-5000 ext. 4287 (computertechnology@georgebrown.ca) or contact Program Co-ordinator Maziar Masoudi at 416-415-5000 ext. 3345 (mmasoudi@georgebrown.ca). For more information, call the Contact Centre at 416-415-2000 or visit campus for an information session or campus tour. Prospective students can sign up to receive tailored resources and make their application online.

Key Information:

* George Brown College has specific requirements beyond minimum grades for program admission
* Applicants may qualify for course exemptions through college/university credits
* Domestic students apply through Ontario Colleges
* Computer Systems Technician program offered through School of Computer Technology at Casa Loma Campus
* Contact information for School and Program Co-ordinator
* Visitors can book a campus tour or info session, and receive tailored resources to aid in the application process.
